verses.verse: ( Property Laws) כִּ֤י <WH3588> kî [“] If יִגְנֹֽב־ <WH1589> yiḡ·nōḇ- steals אִישׁ֙ <WH376> ’îš a man שׁ֣וֹר <WH7794> šō·wr an ox ( Or a bull or a cow; also in verses 4, 9, and 10) אוֹ־ <WH176> ’ōw- or שֶׂ֔ה <WH7716> śeh a sheep וּטְבָח֖וֹ <WH2873> ū·ṭə·ḇā·ḥōw and slaughters א֣וֹ <WH176> ’ōw or מְכָר֑וֹ <WH4376> mə·ḵā·rōw sells it, חֲמִשָּׁ֣ה <WH2568> ḥă·miš·šāh five בָקָ֗ר <WH1241> ḇā·qār oxen יְשַׁלֵּם֙ <WH7999> yə·šal·lêm he must repay תַּ֣חַת <WH8478> ta·ḥaṯ for הַשּׁ֔וֹר <WH7794> haš·šō·wr an ox וְאַרְבַּע־ <WH702> wə·’ar·ba‘- and four צֹ֖אן <WH6629> ṣōn for a sheep. תַּ֥חַת <WH8478> ta·ḥaṯ ... הַשֶּֽׂה׃ <WH7716> haś·śeh sheep

אִם־ <WH518> ’im- If בַּמַּחְתֶּ֛רֶת <WH4290> bam·maḥ·te·reṯ breaking in יִמָּצֵ֥א <WH4672> yim·mā·ṣê is caught הַגַּנָּ֖ב <WH1590> hag·gan·nāḇ a thief וְהֻכָּ֣ה <WH5221> wə·huk·kāh and is beaten וָמֵ֑ת <WH4191> wā·mêṯ to death, אֵ֥ין <WH369> ’ên no one ל֖וֹ Prep│3ms ( lōw) vvv דָּמִֽים׃ 1818 N-mp ( dā·mîm) shall be guilty of bloodshed.

אִם־ <WH518> ’im- But if זָרְחָ֥ה <WH2224> zā·rə·ḥāh it happens after sunrise הַשֶּׁ֛מֶשׁ <WH8121> haš·še·meš ..., עָלָ֖יו <WH5921> ‘ā·lāw ... דָּמִ֣ים <WH1818> dā·mîm there is guilt for his bloodshed ל֑וֹ Prep│3ms ( lōw) .... שַׁלֵּ֣ם 7999 V-Piel-InfAbs ( šal·lêm) A thief must make full restitution יְשַׁלֵּ֔ם 7999 V-Piel-Imperf-3ms ( yə·šal·lêm) ...; אִם־ 518 Conj ( ’im-) if אֵ֣ין 369 Adv ( ’ên) he has nothing ל֔וֹ Prep│3ms ( lōw) , וְנִמְכַּ֖ר 4376 Conj-w│V-Nifal-ConjPerf-3ms ( wə·nim·kar) he himself shall be sold בִּגְנֵבָתֽוֹ׃ 1591 Prep-b│N-fsc│3ms ( biḡ·nê·ḇā·ṯōw) for his theft.

אִֽם־ <WH518> ’im- If what was stolen הִמָּצֵא֩ <WH4672> him·mā·ṣê is actually found תִמָּצֵ֨א <WH4672> ṯim·mā·ṣê ... בְיָד֜וֹ <WH3027> ḇə·yā·ḏōw in his possession — הַגְּנֵבָ֗ה <WH1591> hag·gə·nê·ḇāh ... מִשּׁ֧וֹר <WH7794> miš·šō·wr whether ox עַד־ <WH5704> ‘aḏ- or חֲמ֛וֹר <WH2543> ḥă·mō·wr donkey עַד־ <WH5704> ‘aḏ- or שֶׂ֖ה <WH7716> śeh sheep — חַיִּ֑ים <WH2416> ḥay·yîm alive שְׁנַ֖יִם <WH8147> šə·na·yim double. יְשַׁלֵּֽם׃ס <WH7999> yə·šal·lêm he must pay back

כִּ֤י <WH3588> kî If יַבְעֶר־ <WH1197> yaḇ·‘er- grazes his livestock אִישׁ֙ <WH376> ’îš a man שָׂדֶ֣ה <WH7704> śā·ḏeh in a field אוֹ־ <WH176> ’ōw- or כֶ֔רֶם <WH3754> ḵe·rem vineyard וְשִׁלַּח֙ <WH7971> wə·šil·laḥ to stray אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- - בְּעִירֹה <WH1165> bə·ʿī·rōh and allows them וּבִעֵ֖ר <WH1197> ū·ḇi·‘êr so that they graze בִּשְׂדֵ֣ה <WH7704> biś·ḏêh field, אַחֵ֑ר <WH312> ’a·ḥêr in someone else’s מֵיטַ֥ב <WH4315> mê·ṭaḇ from the best שָׂדֵ֛הוּ <WH7704> śā·ḏê·hū of his own field וּמֵיטַ֥ב <WH4315> ū·mê·ṭaḇ ... כַּרְמ֖וֹ <WH3754> kar·mōw or vineyard. יְשַׁלֵּֽם׃ס <WH7999> yə·šal·lêm he must make restitution

כִּֽי־ <WH3588> kî- If תֵצֵ֨א <WH3318> ṯê·ṣê breaks out אֵ֜שׁ <WH784> ’êš a fire וּמָצְאָ֤ה <WH4672> ū·mā·ṣə·’āh and spreads קֹצִים֙ <WH6975> qō·ṣîm to thornbushes וְנֶאֱכַ֣ל <WH398> wə·ne·’ĕ·ḵal so that it consumes גָּדִ֔ישׁ <WH1430> gā·ḏîš stacked א֥וֹ <WH176> ’ōw or הַקָּמָ֖ה <WH7054> haq·qā·māh standing grain, א֣וֹ <WH176> ’ōw or הַשָּׂדֶ֑ה <WH7704> haś·śā·ḏeh the whole field, שַׁלֵּ֣ם <WH7999> šal·lêm must make full restitution יְשַׁלֵּ֔ם <WH7999> yə·šal·lêm .... הַמַּבְעִ֖ר <WH1197> ham·maḇ·‘ir the one who started אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- - הַבְּעֵרָֽה׃ס <WH1200> hab·bə·‘ê·rāh the fire

כִּֽי־ <WH3588> kî- If יִתֵּן֩ <WH5414> yit·tên gives אִ֨ישׁ <WH376> ’îš a man אֶל־ <WH413> ’el- ... רֵעֵ֜הוּ <WH7453> rê·‘ê·hū his neighbor כֶּ֤סֶף <WH3701> ke·sep̄ money אֽוֹ־ <WH176> ’ōw- or כֵלִים֙ <WH3627> ḵê·lîm goods לִשְׁמֹ֔ר <WH8104> liš·mōr for safekeeping וְגֻנַּ֖ב <WH1589> wə·ḡun·naḇ and they are stolen מִבֵּ֣ית <WH1004> mib·bêṯ house, הָאִ֑ישׁ <WH376> hā·’îš from the neighbor’s אִם־ <WH518> ’im- if יִמָּצֵ֥א <WH4672> yim·mā·ṣê caught, הַגַּנָּ֖ב <WH1590> hag·gan·nāḇ the thief, יְשַׁלֵּ֥ם <WH7999> yə·šal·lêm must pay back שְׁנָֽיִם׃ <WH8147> šə·nā·yim double.

אִם־ <WH518> ’im- If לֹ֤א <WH3808> lō is not יִמָּצֵא֙ <WH4672> yim·mā·ṣê found, הַגַּנָּ֔ב <WH1590> hag·gan·nāḇ the thief וְנִקְרַ֥ב <WH7126> wə·niq·raḇ must appear בַּֽעַל־ <WH1167> ba·‘al- the owner הַבַּ֖יִת <WH1004> hab·ba·yiṯ of the house אֶל־ <WH413> ’el- before הָֽאֱלֹהִ֑ים <WH430> hā·’ĕ·lō·hîm the judges ( Or before God; also in verse 9) אִם־ <WH518> ’im- to determine whether לֹ֥א <WH3808> lō ... שָׁלַ֛ח <WH7971> šā·laḥ he has taken יָד֖וֹ <WH3027> yā·ḏōw ... בִּמְלֶ֥אכֶת <WH4399> bim·le·ḵeṯ property. רֵעֵֽהוּ׃ <WH7453> rê·‘ê·hū his neighbor’s

עַֽל־ <WH5921> ‘al- In כָּל־ <WH3605> kāl- all דְּבַר־ <WH1697> də·ḇar- cases פֶּ֡שַׁע <WH6588> pe·ša‘ of illegal possession עַל־ <WH5921> ‘al- of שׁ֡וֹר <WH7794> šō·wr an ox, עַל־ <WH5921> ‘al- ... חֲ֠מוֹר <WH2543> ḥă·mō·wr a donkey, עַל־ <WH5921> ‘al- ... שֶׂ֨ה <WH7716> śeh a sheep, עַל־ <WH5921> ‘al- ... שַׂלְמָ֜ה <WH8008> śal·māh a garment, עַל־ <WH5921> ‘al- ... כָּל־ <WH3605> kāl- or any אֲבֵדָ֗ה <WH9> ’ă·ḇê·ḏāh lost item אֲשֶׁ֤ר <WH834> ’ă·šer that יֹאמַר֙ <WH559> yō·mar someone claims כִּי־ <WH3588> kî- ..., ה֣וּא <WH1931> hū is mine, ’ זֶ֔ה <WH2088> zeh ‘ This עַ֚ד <WH5704> ‘aḏ before הָֽאֱלֹהִ֔ים <WH430> hā·’ĕ·lō·hîm the judges. יָבֹ֖א <WH935> yā·ḇō shall bring דְּבַר־ <WH1697> də·ḇar- their cases שְׁנֵיהֶ֑ם <WH8147> šə·nê·hem both parties אֲשֶׁ֤ר <WH834> ’ă·šer - יַרְשִׁיעֻן֙ <WH7561> yar·šî·‘un find guilty ( Or whom God condemns) אֱלֹהִ֔ים <WH430> ’ĕ·lō·hîm The one whom the judges יְשַׁלֵּ֥ם <WH7999> yə·šal·lêm must pay back שְׁנַ֖יִם <WH8147> šə·na·yim double לְרֵעֵֽהוּ׃ס <WH7453> lə·rê·‘ê·hū to his neighbor.

כִּֽי־ <WH3588> kî- If יִתֵּן֩ <WH5414> yit·tên gives אִ֨ישׁ <WH376> ’îš a man אֶל־ <WH413> ’el- ... רֵעֵ֜הוּ <WH7453> rê·‘ê·hū by his neighbor, חֲמ֨וֹר <WH2543> ḥă·mō·wr a donkey, אוֹ־ <WH176> ’ōw- שׁ֥וֹר <WH7794> šō·wr an ox, אוֹ־ <WH176> ’ōw- - שֶׂ֛ה <WH7716> śeh a sheep, וְכָל־ <WH3605> wə·ḵāl or any בְּהֵמָ֖ה <WH929> bə·hê·māh other animal לִשְׁמֹ֑ר <WH8104> liš·mōr to be cared for וּמֵ֛ת <WH4191> ū·mêṯ but it dies אוֹ־ <WH176> ’ōw- or נִשְׁבַּ֥ר <WH7665> niš·bar is injured אוֹ־ <WH176> ’ōw- or נִשְׁבָּ֖ה <WH7617> niš·bāh stolen אֵ֥ין <WH369> ’ên while no רֹאֶֽה׃ <WH7200> rō·’eh one is watching,

שְׁבֻעַ֣ת <WH7621> šə·ḇu·‘aṯ an oath יְהוָ֗ה <WH3068> Yah·weh before the LORD תִּהְיֶה֙ <WH1961> tih·yeh shall be made בֵּ֣ין <WH996> bên between שְׁנֵיהֶ֔ם <WH8147> šə·nê·hem the parties אִם־ <WH518> ’im- to determine whether לֹ֥א <WH3808> lō or not שָׁלַ֛ח <WH7971> šā·laḥ the man has taken יָד֖וֹ <WH3027> yā·ḏōw ... בִּמְלֶ֣אכֶת <WH4399> bim·le·ḵeṯ property. רֵעֵ֑הוּ <WH7453> rê·‘ê·hū his neighbor’s וְלָקַ֥ח <WH3947> wə·lā·qaḥ must accept [the oath] בְּעָלָ֖יו <WH1167> bə·‘ā·lāw The owner וְלֹ֥א <WH3808> wə·lō and require no יְשַׁלֵּֽם׃ <WH7999> yə·šal·lêm restitution.

וְאִם־ <WH518> wə·’im- But if גָּנֹ֥ב <WH1589> gā·nōḇ [the animal] was actually יִגָּנֵ֖ב <WH1589> yig·gā·nêḇ stolen מֵעִמּ֑וֹ <WH5973> mê·‘im·mōw from [the neighbor], יְשַׁלֵּ֖ם <WH7999> yə·šal·lêm he must make restitution לִבְעָלָֽיו׃ <WH1167> liḇ·‘ā·lāw to the owner.

אִם־ <WH518> ’im- If טָרֹ֥ף <WH2963> ṭā·rōp̄ [the animal] was torn to pieces יִטָּרֵ֖ף <WH2963> yiṭ·ṭā·rêp̄ ..., יְבִאֵ֣הוּ <WH935> yə·ḇi·’ê·hū he shall bring עֵ֑ד <WH5707> ‘êḏ it as evidence; הַטְּרֵפָ֖ה <WH2966> haṭ·ṭə·rê·p̄āh for the torn carcass. לֹ֥א <WH3808> lō he need not יְשַׁלֵּֽם׃פ <WH7999> yə·šal·lêm make restitution

וְכִֽי־ <WH3588> wə·ḵî- If יִשְׁאַ֥ל <WH7592> yiš·’al borrows אִ֛ישׁ <WH376> ’îš a man מֵעִ֥ם <WH5973> mê·‘im [an animal] רֵעֵ֖הוּ <WH7453> rê·‘ê·hū from his neighbor וְנִשְׁבַּ֣ר <WH7665> wə·niš·bar and it is injured אוֹ־ <WH176> ’ōw- or מֵ֑ת <WH4191> mêṯ dies בְּעָלָ֥יו <WH1167> bə·‘ā·lāw while its owner אֵין־ <WH369> ’ên- is not עִמּ֖וֹ <WH5973> ‘im·mōw present, שַׁלֵּ֥ם <WH7999> šal·lêm he must make full restitution יְשַׁלֵּֽם׃ <WH7999> yə·šal·lêm ....

אִם־ <WH518> ’im- If בְּעָלָ֥יו <WH1167> bə·‘ā·lāw the owner עִמּ֖וֹ <WH5973> ‘im·mōw was present, לֹ֣א <WH3808> lō no יְשַׁלֵּ֑ם <WH7999> yə·šal·lêm restitution is required. אִם־ <WH518> ’im- If שָׂכִ֣יר <WH7916> śā·ḵîr was rented, ה֔וּא <WH1931> hū [the animal] בָּ֖א <WH935> bā ... בִּשְׂכָרֽוֹ׃ס <WH7939> biś·ḵā·rōw the fee covers the loss.

( Laws of Social Responsibility) וְכִֽי־ <WH3588> wə·ḵî- If יְפַתֶּ֣ה <WH6601> yə·p̄at·teh seduces אִ֗ישׁ <WH376> ’îš a man בְּתוּלָ֛ה <WH1330> bə·ṯū·lāh a virgin אֲשֶׁ֥ר <WH834> ’ă·šer who לֹא־ <WH3808> lō- is not אֹרָ֖שָׂה <WH781> ’ō·rā·śāh pledged in marriage וְשָׁכַ֣ב <WH7901> wə·šā·ḵaḇ and sleeps עִמָּ֑הּ <WH5973> ‘im·māh with her, מָהֹ֛ר <WH4117> mā·hōr he must pay the full dowry יִמְהָרֶ֥נָּה <WH4117> yim·hā·ren·nāh ... לּ֖וֹ Prep│3ms ( lōw) for her לְאִשָּֽׁה׃ 802 Prep-l│N-fs ( lə·’iš·šāh) to be his wife.

אִם־ <WH518> ’im- If מָאֵ֧ן <WH3985> mā·’ên absolutely refuses יְמָאֵ֛ן <WH3985> yə·mā·’ên ... אָבִ֖יהָ <WH1> ’ā·ḇî·hā her father לְתִתָּ֣הּ <WH5414> lə·ṯit·tāh to give her ל֑וֹ Prep│3ms ( lōw) to him, כֶּ֣סֶף 3701 N-ms ( ke·sep̄) an amount comparable יִשְׁקֹ֔ל 8254 V-Qal-Imperf-3ms ( yiš·qōl) [the man] still must pay כְּמֹ֖הַר 4119 Prep-k│N-msc ( kə·mō·har) to the bridal price הַבְּתוּלֹֽת׃ס 1330 Art│N-fp ( hab·bə·ṯū·lōṯ) of a virgin.
מְכַשֵּׁפָ֖ה <WH3784> mə·ḵaš·šê·p̄āh allow a sorceress לֹ֥א <WH3808> lō You must not תְחַיֶּֽה׃ס <WH2421> ṯə·ḥay·yeh to live.
כָּל־ <WH3605> kāl- Whoever שֹׁכֵ֥ב <WH7901> šō·ḵêḇ lies עִם־ <WH5973> ‘im- with בְּהֵמָ֖ה <WH929> bə·hê·māh an animal מ֥וֹת <WH4191> mō·wṯ must surely be put to death יוּמָֽת׃ס <WH4191> yū·māṯ ....

זֹבֵ֥חַ <WH2076> zō·ḇê·aḥ [If] anyone sacrifices לָאֱלֹהִ֖ים <WH430> lā·’ĕ·lō·hîm to any god יָֽחֳרָ֑ם <WH2763> yā·ḥo·rām he must be set apart for destruction. ( Forms of the Hebrew cherem refer to the giving over of things or persons to the LORD, either by destroying them or by giving them as an offering.) בִּלְתִּ֥י <WH1115> bil·tî other than לַיהוָ֖ה <WH3068> Yah·weh the LORD לְבַדּֽוֹ׃ <WH905> lə·ḇad·dōw alone,
